events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their car and another vehicle at an intersection, resulting in significant damage to the front bumper and headlights.
The claim has been categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a personal vehicle in the reported collision.
An insurance agent specializing in auto claims has been assigned to handle the customer's case to ensure proper processing.
The customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim has been acknowledged by the insurance company and is under review.
The insurance company requested the customer to submit photographs of the vehicle damage, police accident report, and a repair estimate.
The customer uploaded all requested documents, including photos, police report, and the repair shop’s cost estimate for the damages.
The claims investigator commenced reviewing the submitted materials and contacting witnesses to verify the circumstances of the auto accident.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the customer was not at fault and that the damage estimate is valid for repair coverage.
A settlement offer based on repair costs and policy terms has been proposed to the customer for their approval.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and confirmed agreement to proceed with the payout.
The insurance company officially approved the claim, authorizing the payment to cover vehicle repairs as agreed with the customer.
Payment for the auto repair costs was issued to the customer’s bank account as per the approved settlement.
The claim was formally closed following successful payment and confirmation from the customer that repairs were completed.
All records and documentation associated with the auto accident claim have been archived for future reference in accordance with compliance policies.
